characters: THUNK THUNK. THUNK THUNK. THUNK THUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect suburban house with bay windows and a front law The SHAW family. Caucasian and warm - RICHARD, 34; NANCY, JOSHUA, 6; and MAY, 4 - eat dinner inside. Richard reads something on his tablet illuminating his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one are we going to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one in Orlando.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disney World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony said that Mickey is not really Mickey; it's someone else in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey's Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDRE, 29, an African-American man runs down the sidewalk sweats. He listens to jazz on his phone. The music stops. stops running and checks his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right in front of the Shaw's house. He glances insid The Shaw's seem normal and content. Andre smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A motion detecting security light floods the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard looks up from his table to see Andre standing the The rest of the family doesn't notice. Nancy tends to May SQUIRMS in her chair. Richard watches Andre protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, Tony said he saw a chef Mickey and a normal Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have changed his clothes for work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre walks on. It's getting dark. He is suddenly very al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vintage creme-colored Porsche Boxter with tinted window a roof CREEPS up on the street behind Andre. It's followi him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's POV watching Andre. His BREATH ECHOES deep and t as if it were into a coffee can. Through the car's system hear an English to French language tutorial recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me. Where is the nearest restaurant? Pardonnez-moi. Ou est le restaurant le plus proche?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver doesn't repeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre, feeling followed, stops to tie his shoe. The car a stops. Andre waves at the unseen DRIVER. There is no resp The ENGINE PURRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre begins walking again. The car begins slowly too. An stops again. The car does too. Andre peers through the windshield but can't see through the tint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm new to the area. I just moved here... Down on Evergreen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Did I do something wrong? 'Cause--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's POV. Andre continues to talk, but isn't heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you show me the nearest bathroom? Pouvez-vous me montrer la salle de bain la plus prouche?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre hears nothing from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) This is some shit right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre begins walking. The car creeps alongside him. After few steps, Andre stops again. The car stops. Andre laughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I know you? You messing with me right?..Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He realizes it's not a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this could be considered stalking and harassment. Plus, you're sitting in a deadly weapon so that's some felony-type shit right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!? Say something then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Andre can't hide his anger anymore. He start walking the other direction. The car backs up, following in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Andre. Don't do it. Don't let him get to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few more steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre, fed up, stops. He approaches the passenger's side window and bangs on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Brooklyn, man. If you wanna do something, then let's do something. I'm ready..! Hey, I'm talkin' to you!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver's POV. Andre bangs on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre bangs harder on the window three times. The car's passenger-side window rolls down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me find a hotel? Pouvez-vous m'aider a trouver mon hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre's expression goes from anger to terror. The driver a tubular metal medieval knight's helmet with slanted rectangular eye holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver raises a gun with a silencer on it. Andre turn run but is shot in the back. Stunned, Andre stumbles towa the Shaw's house. The driver exits the car and follows hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (From inside the car) Can you please call the police? Pouvez-vous s'il vous plait appelez la police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre falls in front of the Shaw's lawn. A dart sticks ou his back. He reaches towards the Shaw family. The masked driver approaches calmly Andre drags himself toward the h as everything blurs around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre passes out as the security light floods the lawn ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shaw family eats while Andre lays on their front lawn This time Richard, buried in his tablet, doesn't notice. driver lift Andre's limp body and carries him to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony said Mickey's face doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Mickey's always happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver carries Andre to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he hasn't aged in 100 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver plops Andre in the padded trunk. He gets in hi and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the city. Autumn. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move slowly through the small but clean apartment. The walls are decorated with fascinating urban photography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS WASHINGTON, 26, a handsome African-American man shu the medicine cabinet. He's shirtless and naturally athlet He scrutinizes his reflection with a touch of vanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE ARMITAGE, 28 - Caucasian, brunette with freckles - c and beautiful like an old Summer Camp crush. Rose looks a pastries through the glass. She can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris spreads shaving cream onto his face and shaves. He postures a little then nicks himself on the neck. He smir deserved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, clothed, looks out his window through a profession camera. He flips through some striking urban images on th digital display much like the ones framed around his apartment. He is a very talented photographer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, a small black dog, watches him. The BUZZER RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris opens the door. Rose stands outside the apartment w her hands full. She has two coffees and two bags of pastr Chris smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't decide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the coffee tray and pulls her inside. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris have coffee and sweets by the window. The mound of pastries sits on the coffee table. SID lays on h lap. She strokes him. It's a perfect morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing. Do you even pet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? When you're not here that dog gets the best fuckin' pets of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how come whenever I come over, he acts like he's been totally neglected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause he know he's got you wrapped around his little paw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris picks up her foot sweetly and massages it. She melt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris packs a small bag of luggage. Rose lays on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toothbrush... Deodorant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check... Check....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris puts a cigarette in his mouth. Rose pops up and gra the cigarette from his mouth and breaks it. Chris tries t feign incredulousness but is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna have one the whole weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You quit, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? They're going to love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, you're smart, sweet, handsome, creative... You're you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris packs in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know I'm black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is taken aback by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Why? Should they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like you might give them a heads up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Like "Mom, Dad, my black boyfriend is coming up for the weekend"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, I'm the first black guy you'd ever dated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is uncharted territory for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, it's fine. My dad would legit vote for Obama a third time he could. Yes, he will want to talk to you about it, and that will be embarrassing, but they're gonna love you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods. She kisses his neck and pulls him to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns on the TV for Sid. He and Rose stand by the f door about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose blows Sid a kiss and they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris puts his luggage in the trunk and enters the passen side of a shiny white BMW X5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits in the driver's seat. Chris gets in the passeng seat. Her car is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do they even let you in a hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. I'm very sanitary at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves some fast food wrappers to the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises her phone and takes a selfie of the two of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris puts his hand on her leg, and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car leaves the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We soar over the car as it drives through the beautiful countryside; a road flanked by woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose hums. Chris, in the passengers seat, looks through h camera at the passing trees. He snaps a test shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long has it been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 months, so a year basically; longest I've ever been away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris takes out another cigarette. Rose promptly grabs it opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... whoa!! Come on! I'm a grown man. If a man says he wants a cigarette, a man should be able

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so that's like a dollar. You basically just throwin' dollars out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have bought them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't buy them. Rod... Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost forgot Rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROD WILLIAMS, 26, African American, a stocky TSA agent sm a cigarette. His cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Sup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sits in the passenger seat and talks on the cell ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. How I'm gonna get in trouble for following standard procedure? Fuckin' Gary out here thinkin' just because a bitch old, she can't hijack an airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you can't hide a bomb in a wheelchair? Watch, Chris, the next 9/11 is gonna be on some geriatric shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, real quick. You good to watch Sid this weekend right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You think I forgot? Damn `C', give your boy a little credit. I don't forget shit; you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apology accepted. How's `Lil Miss Rosie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattup babygirl? You better bring my boy back in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what that means but yes I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you picked the wrong guy though right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late for us is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris takes the phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get your own girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, I never seen you like this. Meeting the family and everything? What does she do lick your ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! First girl licks your ass and you done. Just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod makes a WHIPPING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I do. I need your girl to introduce me to one of her freaky deaky boarding school friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. Oh, and I'll kick you some cash for watching Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, son! I don't need your money. I got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not come back all bougie on me tho--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hangs up. He gives Rose a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What..? Settle down. You know I'm yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat he puts another cigarette in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes for it. He dodges playfully and tickles her caus her to cackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow darts across the road in front of the hood of th car. It's hind legs SMACK the hood of the car with a loud THWAT-THWAT. It's propelled into the woods at an awkward angle. The CAR SCREECHES to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose breathe hard for a few moments of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That scared the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose gets out of her car and inspects the damage. Chris g out as well. There's a small bloody dent in the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks back in the direction of the collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... See if it's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks a few more steps then stops. He rethinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's gone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guttural, almost human, MOAN OF PAIN comes from in the behind them. They watch the woods in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks back towards the haunting wail. It stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris motions for Rose the stay. He keeps walking towards thicket about 60 ft behind the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gathers his courage and takes a step toward the thi The Moan starts again, but much loader and closer than Ch realized. He's startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris peers through the bushes. The deer lays there gaspi for breaths and watching him with a black wet eye. Chris transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris snaps to. He nods and takes out his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop car is now pulled up to where the deer was hit. OFF FROSTIE - Caucasian - 33 stands near the deer. Another officer, OFFICER CROW - 40 - Caucasian with a patronizing smirk, stands by the driver's side window of Rose's car w Rose and Chris are both back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in the future the number to call is Animal Control Services.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose doesn't like the way he's looking at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. That makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two coming up from the city?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what brings you up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from here. The Lake Pontaco area? We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a driver's license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gives Rose a "see?" Look as he gets his license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I don't have a driver's license, I have a state I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask who was driving. I asked him for his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boyfriend shouldn't have to show you his I.D. because he hasn't done anything wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, any time there is an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, fuck that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby. It's okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit, and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a tense silence. Officer Crowe's walkie chimes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything alright up there Crowsie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Crowe stares Rose down. After a moment he presses walkie button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm all good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Chris his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car winds through a thickly wooded road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sits in the passenger's seat deep in thought. He wa Rose with a new awe. Rose notices. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not gonna let anyone fuck with my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was some ride or die shit, baby. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods give way to an huge front lawn. A large mansion in the middle. Thick forest surrounds the estate except f one side which is the edge of a lake. The property feels expensive and isolated; no other houses in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they drive through the large front lawn, Chris sees WA African American 35 in the distance facing away. Walter w a gardening hat and trims hedges. He works slowly and methodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the grounds-keeper... I think his name is Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose parks in front of the house, and. He has a pleasant smile. Rose gets out of the car and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns and waves back. Chris gets out and waves too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter waves silently. Odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chris gets the luggage from the trunk, Rose runs to th front door and RINGS the DOORBELL. FOOTSTEPS. The door sw open revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN ARMITAGE, 59, a tall, balding, barrel-chested, bear of a man. Though clearly smart, Dean has an endearing cockiness and a bad case of Dad humor. He is the kind of who pronounces garbage, Gar-bahge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... MISSY ARMITAGE, 56, A beautiful beacon of intellec patience. She is poised and warm; relaxed and in control. stand in the shadows of the doorway smiling. Rose hugs he parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's my girl! Hello sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We miss you, Ro Ro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris approaches with the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, these are my parents. Mom, Dad, this is Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to finally meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris holds his hand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Armitage will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean grabs Chris' arm and pulls Chris in tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Dean. We hug around here, Fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife Missy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard so much about you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy holds Chris' shoulders and examines his face and ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you'll do just fine. So handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get inside before you guys start embarrassing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, come inside, make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine with the embarrassing by the way; go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy and Dean laugh. The four enter the house. Missy shu the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Walter watches as his smile fades away. He slowl turns and goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonderful house looms ahead. The interior is worldly an interesting; clean and homey. Several paintings of castle medieval battles accent the walls. Taxidermy. One wall is bookshelf, and there is a fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the fireplace is a large hauntingly beautiful portr an old man and woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wow" is good. We'll take wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up in a one bedroom, so for me, this is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ought to be. Lord knows we've done enough work on it through the years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Rose and Chris) How was the ride in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hit a deer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Down around Lyons road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It came out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. It just fruck us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I say. One down... a few hundred thousand to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean. So awful! Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Those things are everywhere up here, Chris; like rats. The damage they've done to the ecology alone... Anyway, are we ready for the grand tour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them unload their bags first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave `em. Walter will get `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'll manage, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris take their bags upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose's old room is preserved in the state of a young-mind teenage girl. Lots of pink and dated boy band posters, a stuffed lion. A window overlooks the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris place their bags down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they wish I was still a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot believe they kept it the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks at some pictures posted on her dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're totally sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you they'd love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a picture of Rose in high school on stage in a production of `The Crucible.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Is this you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Crucible." I was Abigail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you acted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot you don't know about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose grabs Chris by the belt and pulls him to the bed on of her. They kiss. She goes for his fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what about the tour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The tour?" Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got here. I don't wanna be disrespectful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a fuck? Be disrespectful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Chris walk and look at pictures on the wall. Ros Missy catch up in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankenstein's monster. Only pieces of the original structure remain; I like to think the soul is in tact though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are seven bedrooms, ten bathrooms, three indoor dining areas, two study's, two main kitchens. There's an observatory wing on the top floor. And you'd be hard pressed to find a room that doesn't serve as library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris zones in on a photograph taken in the 90's in front the Armitage house. Dean and Missy are younger, and Rose her brother Jeremy are kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Jeremy. Rose's brother. He's in Med school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went through a couple dark spots but came out the other side. You'll meet him later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean points out the older couple in the picture, the same the portrait in the living room; GRANDPA and GRANDMA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Father lived here till the end. They died a few years ago now. Passed away within weeks of each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that happens a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Love" is a powerful thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move down the hallway to a black and white framed pi of a 25 year old man posing in the starting position for race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad was a runner. A good runner; great sprinter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, In fact, you might find this interesting, he was just beat out by Jessie Owens in the qualifying round for the `36 Olympics in Berlin. That's the one where--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Owens won in front of Hitler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. That one always just stood out in my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. One of those perfect moments. There's Hitler on his high horse with his perfect Aryan race, and here comes this black guy to prove him wrong on the world's stage. What a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tough break for your father though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He almost got over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean opens the door to the office. He and Chris stand out the door as Dean reaches in to turn on the lights. In fro the desk two comfortable-looking chairs face each other. line the walls, and are stacked everywhere. Dean and Chri don't enter. A white cat laying next to a teacup wakes up the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Snowbell just looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy's office. This is where she takes appointments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Therapist right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. One of the best in the world. Not a tidy woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like mother like daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Cackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neurosurgeon; was. I retired early. Now, I pretty much focus on the house and twiddle my thumbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Chris pass a closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, downstairs is the wine cellar, the games room, some storage. Apparently a black mold issue down there. Almost everything needs to get thrown out; shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean and Chris continue their walk-through. The kitchen i large, homey and pristine. Large windows overlook the backyard. GEORGINA, African American, 30 stands facing a She is still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother loved her kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon hearing them, Georgina comes alive. She resumes clea the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Georgina, this is Chris; Rose's boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina turns to them. She has the same eerie smile as Walter. Like she's masking something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ha! But now for the piece de resistance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean opens the glass back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yard is huge and the woods beyond it ominous. The win RUSHES through the trees. Dean leads Chris out through th yard towards a gazebo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badminton and bocce ball, croquet; we're a family who loves games. Two other families have properties on lake Pontaco, and they're way on the other side. Total privacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is distracted by Walter who prepares the lawn mower the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-to-do white family; black servants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't gonna go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to. We hired them a few years ago to help care for my parents; they became part of the family. Couldn't bear to let them go. I hate the way it makes us look though...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. People need work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at an outdoor patio. Dean stops Chris from stepping on a dead sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter turns to face them. He has that same eerily mild s Vacant in its sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dead bird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn things fly into the patio from time to time; break their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods slowly. Dean gently kicks the bird's carcass of their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iced tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean, Missy, Chris and Rose sit with iced teas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose tells us your parents aren't with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad was never really in the picture. My mom passed away when I was 11; She was hit by a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's awful; so young. I'm so sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My aunt raised me, with my cousins. We didn't have a lot of money or anything, but she's a good person; kept me off the streets. She gave me my first camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose holds Chris' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two seem like you've been together for years. How long has it been now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 months? 5 months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5? She's right; I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Atta boy Chris. Get used to saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a lot of time, anyway. So...? You guys in love or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we've been trying to take it slow but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. You're in love. I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't resist the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter mows past them in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how did you meet, again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the blood drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when I volunteered at the community center?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he really is so good looking, isn't he? You'd have beautiful babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Get out of here before it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, all you have to do is just quit smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! A smoker!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we were just beginning to like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have Missy take care of that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypnosis. Works like a charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy watches Chris' reaction intently. He is uncomfortab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the whole thing was B.S. too. I smoked for 20 years. She puts me under once, now the sight of a cigarette makes me wanna vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, I'd give you the service for free. You are family after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I don't... Thank you. Um, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks to Rose for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys, normal people don't want strangers fiddling around in their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you change your mind... We're just glad you could join us for the big get-together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina brings the pitcher of iced tea around and refill everyone's glass. Chris tries to thank her with a look. S smiles and avoids eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The get-together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party tomorrow? I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well we host a shindig once a year for our friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tradition. Some of my Dad's old social club. Some old patients. Some just friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks, good food, good people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina has been pouring Chris' drink too long and his g has overflown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina snaps out of her daze. She realizes what she's d and starts to clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine George, I'll get it. Maybe you need a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina nods, smiles and walks away. Chris and Rose look Dean. That was odd. Dean shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR HORN HONKS in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEREMY, 29, rounds the house with open arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's "Rich kid intense"; handsome and strong with an unpredictable wildness behind his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who answers the door around here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean pours the remainder of a bottle of wine into Chris' glass. Their meal is done and they are tipsy. Jeremy pops cork on a new bottle of wine as he energetically holds co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more... So, let me set the scene. I'm a junior; Ro's a freshman and she has a crush on this guy Connor--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --No. Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... These are good. I wanna hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manners, Rose. Give the guest what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor Garfield was on my lacrosse team. Huge guy, like 6'3", and crazy, just like "Looney Tunes," right? We had thrown a party--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my parents were in Greece or something. We had gotten into their liquor cabinet and we're all shit-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you weren't. Were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We put water in the bottles so you wouldn't know. Let me finish. Okay, so I'm upstairs in my parents' bathroom hooking up with Jenny Richardson. Hottest girl in our class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize you're coming off like a total douche right now, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. All of a sudden Connor starts banging on the bathroom door, right? I open it, and he's got blood gushing out of his mouth and he's screaming "Your thith-ter bit my fuckin' thongue off!!!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, there is a centimeter of tongue meat missing right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy demonstrates and Chris winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! You bit him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cornered me and shoved his tongue in my mouth, so yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. That's badass, Bae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to see how dessert is coming along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can change the conversation to something a little lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, great story. Thanks for making it totally uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy walks out of the dining room into the kitchen. The swings open and Chris gets another glimpse of Georgina wh stands with a kitchen knife and wears an intense and wick little smile. The door swings shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, new subject. Chris, Yanks or Mets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Orioles. My mom was from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You an MMA fan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. Let someone else talk for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had your chance. He's dating my sister. I can't bond with the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like UFC? Yeah, nah. Too brutal for me. I'm a lover, not a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever get into street fights as a kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. I did take Judo for after-school in 1st grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause, with your frame, your genetic make-up? If you pushed your body, I mean really trained, you'd be a beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool... Thanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen door swings open again, and Missy walks back with a perfect carrot cake. Georgina is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More ramblings from King Awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about sports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up. Let me show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No karate at the dinner table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not karate, it's jiu-jitsu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles a little towards Chris and tries to put him i headlock. Chris stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a rule. I don't play- fight with drunk dudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Alright, enough Jeremy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't going to hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean is loud and stern for the first time. Jeremy's eyes flutter, DRUNK and embarrassed. He grabs a wine bottle an goes upstairs`.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full moon. CRICKETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris make hushed love in her bed. A stuffed lio seems to watch Chris. He turns it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sleeps, but Chris is wide awake. There's a buzz in h ear. He smacks his own head and sits up. A soft HOWL of W rushes through the room. The CLOSET DOOR CREEKS open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' eyes drift to the pack of cigarettes sticking out his camera bag pocket draped on the desk chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris leaves Rose's room and walks down the dark hallway. floorboard creaks under his feet. He turns down the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gets to the bottom of the stairs. He hears the floorboard creek upstairs. He stops and turns, expecting someone to follow him down. Nothing. Chris continues to w down the hallway past the pictures towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement door is open a crack. Chris peers into it curiously. A stairwell leads down into pitch darkness. Ch shuts the door. A figure now stands at the end of the hal behind him. He doesn't notice. He just keeps going into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks through the kitchen. He bumps into a bar chai moving it slightly. He keeps walking. He continues out th sliding back door of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris steps out the back door and takes a cigarette out. looks into the vast night around him. The CRICKETS are deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, something DARTS FAST across the yard in the distance. Chris peers out into the darkness. The thing RU across the lawn again. A moment of terror comes over Chri makes out a shape. It's now running towards him. Chris ba up in fear just as the figure emerges from the shadows an into the moonlight. It's Walter, the grounds keeper. He p Chris without noticing. Chris gathers his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen light turns on and floods the backyard. Chris drops the cigarette and stomps it out. He turns back towa the house and finds himself face to face with Georgina, w glares through the window dead in Chris' eyes. He's caugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina doesn't react. Chris it still. Georgina suddenly exposes her teeth in a frightening grimace. Chris backs a slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgina sucks her teeth. She doesn't actually see Chris all. She's looking at her teeth in the reflection in the window which, front lit, reflects her and the room around Outside is invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris realizes he's not caught. Close call. Inside Georgi notices the bar chair has been moved. She moves it back i its original position, and begins cleaning the kitchen cabinets. Chris quietly sneaks around the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sneaks in through the door in the dark dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris moves through the living room towards the stairs, t lamp in the middle of the room turns on startling Chris. sits near him; cat in lap; almost seductively. He's caugh for real this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Nerves got me I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. Let's nip this in the bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy sits in a chair and directs Chris to sit across fro her. She pours them both some tea. Chris sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't know if this is right for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There really is no need to be nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. The dude was running out there. Scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter starts early every day. He's borderline obsessive compulsive. Tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm good. It'll keep me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy puts two sugar cubes in her cup. She begins to stir slowly, CLINKING the SPOON softly and rhythmically agains sides of the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the bed. Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough sheets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how does this work? Are you going to swing a pocket watch in front of my face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch a lot of Television. Now, you are feeling very sleeepy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do use focal points sometimes, but just about any object or simple motion can guide someone to a state of heightened suggestibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heightened suggestibility. Okay, where do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my memory sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wounds get locked in your heart and they fester and grow into ugly little things like depression and addiction. But, they are all in there somewhere. All we need to do is find the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world around Chris slowly goes out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess if it makes me quit... Wait... Has it started--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --we're going to go back to a place that might be uncomfortable for you. Your Mother's death to be specific. Were you there when she was hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was home. I was watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back there. Hear this place. Let the vibrations rush run through your body and ears. Hear it... Find it... Tell me when you find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of RAIN AGAINST a WINDOW slowly fades up along the MUFFLED sound of a SITCOM ON TELEVISION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Yeah, I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How did you find out she died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. She was never late after work. When she didn't come home, I just knew something was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now touch. Feel your surroundings. Feel every part of your body and what you touched. Feel it. Find it... Tell me when you find it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on 11 year old Chris' hands scratches the bed post nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me when you find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His toes brush the carpet as his dangling legs swing off side of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' feet try to swing but are too long. He scratches t arm of the chair in Missy's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said `you knew something was wrong.' What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just sat there. Watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't call someone? Your Aunt or the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I thought if I did, it would make it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next is smell and taste. Breathe in and let the scent fill your nose. Smell that place. Taste it. Find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is getting emotional. He breathes deep through his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Chris finishes inhaling. The rain hits the window s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me. Tell me when you find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Chris takes sip of a juice box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 year old Chris sips from an invisible straw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now lastly, you must see it. Let the light flood into your eyes. Every color, every detail. See it. See it. Find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' eyelids flutter. He continues to scratch the armch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11-year-old Chris scratches through the wood on his bed, splintering the wood. He watches TV from his bed next to action figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11-year-old Chris nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it was your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to feel that fear again, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris trembles anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you afraid now? Paralyzed like that day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. Her empathetic expression turns into a sick smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Now sink into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sink! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' hand has compulsively scratched open the arm of th chair. His hand stops. His mouth drops and eyes open, fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, 11-year-old Chris falls through the bed and flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror. Chris, 26 again, breathes fast but falls in slow motion though darkness as if through water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flails towards a pitch black abyss. He's illuminated b fading blue flicker of a large downward facing TV-like sc On it Missy sits Speaking to him and clinking her teacup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy's voice is everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Sink. Sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' body sits in his chair motionless. He can't move. eyes are wide open, staring strait at Missy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris continues to slowly fall backwards. Missy approache the screen above him. It shows what his eyes are seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! NO!!! I'm done! Bring me back! Please!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response. Chris cries. Eventually he slows do and comes to a stop. He lands feet first on a soft ground This place sounds like it's crawling with insects. He loo up. He can still see the screen above but it is far away, the mouth of a deep and expansive well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Armitage!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the screen, Missy stands. She walks towards Chris' bod looks down at him through his own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you are in the Sunken Place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missy reaches towards the screen and shuts his eyelids. T abyss goes almost completely dark. Now he's alone in the He cries in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hears a DEEP HULKING BREATHING in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's down here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me back. Bring me back. Bring me back. Bring me back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, the SOUND OF HOOVES CRUNCHING ON SOFT GR approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me back. Bring me back. Bring me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds get louder and louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An antlered thing emerges from the shadow. It's head is t of a deer, but with the flesh stripped off and with mostl skull exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its eyes glow and flicker faint blue in its sockets. It M A WRONG SOUNDING MOAN; in hateful anguish. It charges Chr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody deer impales Chris on its antlers. They both M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris wakes up with a start in Rose's bed sweaty and heav He's alone and confused. Bad dream? Headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOWER RUNS inside Rose's bathroom. SHE HUMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotten a message. It's a picture of Rod pretending t pour beer in Sid's mouth. Chris smiles. The batteries are He plugs his phone in and puts it on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Golden hour. Beautiful. Chris walks through the yard the edge of the forest with his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris keeps walking. He looks through a long-zoom lens in the wilderness. He sees a bird and snaps a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the house. Georgina can be seen through an upstairs window knitting. He raises his camera. She's beautiful. She stands and begins to remove her wig. Then aware she's being watched, she turns towards him. Chris t away, taking a picture in another direction. He glances b at the window. Georgina is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG. A sparrow slams against the gazebo and falls to the ground. Startling Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away and is startled even more by Walter smiling serenely at him about 50 feet away in the yard. Embarrass Chris gathers himself. He walks towards Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They working you good out here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter's voice is soft and methodical. His eyes remain di as though he his looking through Chris. Chilling. There i hidden anger behind his pleasantness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing I don't want to be doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter isn't joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah. No, I can tell. I never really got to meet you actually, up close. I'm Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. You're Rose's friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris stops walking about 15 feet from Walter. Something doesn't feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's one way to put it. So, where you from originally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is lovely isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose? Yeah, she is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of a kind; a real doggone keeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is weirded out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry if I scared you last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Actually, I guess I was pretty drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hypnosis? Did it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypnosis? No, I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I should get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris raises his hand in a timid `black power fist.' Walt raises his hand in an open wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another bird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter nods. Chris turns and walks to the house. Chris ma pops a cigarette into his mouth. He is repulsed by the ta of it. He looks at it. More of last night seems to come b to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris enters as Rose finishes blow drying her hair. He's worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. Taking pictures. Hey, so I think your mom hypnotised me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I snuck out for a smoke, and she caught me and offered? I don't know. I must have agreed to it `cause the thing just made me nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Well then that's good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not good. I can barely remember any of it even happening; I don't like that. Plus I had these fucked up dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happened to me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightmares. When I was a kid. She hypnotized me once for stage fright, and I had the craziest nightmares, but it worked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps herself up in Chris' arms. Chris thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what's the deal with the help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like... The iced tea thing? Yeah that was weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, but also the lawn-mower guy creepin' me the fuck out too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Did he say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not what he says, it's how he says it. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, something about them seems... different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, A CAR DRIVES onto the front yard. Rose he and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks as well. A car parks on the front lawn. A Cha gets out and opens the backseat passenger door. A well-tr Husky service dog exits the car followed by JIM HUDSON, 5 Jim is blind and has slicked back grey hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird's-eye view. Walter helps direct 12 expensive cars on makeshift parking lot on the front lawn. Wealthy guests e from each one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is in full swing. The 30 or so guests mingle excitedly. They are all white except for one Japanese man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the kitchen window, Georgina fixes food and helps occupy four white children by helping them make Hors d'oeuvres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris get a drink at the bar. They walk through party. Missy mingles with some guests. She makes eye cont with Chris and winks. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose are stopped by GORDON GREENE, 68, and his EMILY GREENE, 67. Gordon is a cute man with a cane and im excitement. Emily is pretty and birdlike. They watch Chri intently and smile from ear to ear. Gordon shakes Chris' thoroughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Chris. Nice to meet you indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever play golf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once, actually; a few years ago. I wasn't very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon was a professional golfer for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? No kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't quite swing the hips like I used to though. You know, I met Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris share a subtle smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that's great. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon loves Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best I've ever seen. Ever, hands down. Let's see your form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I could barely hit the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I knew what I know now at your age? Now then I could really play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'd be kind of a waste of time travel though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose speak to NELSON DEETS, 82, who's smiles in wheelchair with his jaw hanging, and LISA DEETS, 54, a lo lipped trophy wife smiles at Chris in a predatory manner. have Dutch accents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How handsome is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extremely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa squeezes Chris' bicep. A bit too familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad huh, Nelson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, is it true? The love making. Is it better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose cackles at the bluntness of the question. Chris almo chokes on his drink. Lisa continues to size Chris up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Um..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being too forward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, will you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose talk to PARKER DRAY, 60, and APRIL DRAY, 5 They are an overweight, rose-cheeked tipsy wasp couple. C and Rose try to mask boredom and annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who even cares about skin color? My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I mean--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world cares, April. But it's not a question of physical superiority, it's "What skin color is more culturally advantageous?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Parker drones on Chris looks around the party. Dean schmoozes animatedly with two couples. He quickly scans t party, finds Chris and points him out. The two couples wa and smile giddily. They had all just been talking about h Chris pretends to not see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Advantageous?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Chris sees another black guy walking through th crowd. Relief. It is Andre, the jogger from the first sce but he's very different than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems glazed-over with the same frozen smile as Walter Georgina, and wears a particularly square ascot and golfi hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairer skin is has been in favor' the last couple of thousands of years, but the pendulum has swung back again hasn't it..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm going to get another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to offend him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? `Cause you have yet to say anything that's not a blanket statement about race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Rose.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre stands by the bar and makes himself a Martini. Chri approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see another brother around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre turns to face Chris neatly. Andre's voice is comple different from the first scene. There is no longer any tr of an urban dialect. He speaks in a lower pitch and slow, enunciating his words precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris expects Andre to engage more. He doesn't. He just s at him smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, the Armitage's of course. We're friends of the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIL, 65, a craggy effeminate man with manicured eyebrows cuts between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. Here, put this somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil hands his napkin to Andre who pockets it obediently. places his hand on Andre's back possessively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. I'm Phil... and you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris. Rose's boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. Logan and I know Rose very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, where are my manners. Logan, Logan King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris was just telling me that he felt more comfortable with my being here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is let down. Andre isn't what he had hoped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Logan, I hate to tear you away, dear, but the Wincott's were asking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, well it was nice meeting you Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris holds out his fist for Andre/Logan to bump. Andre/L shakes Chris' fist and then, realizing his error fist bum him like it's the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan and Phil laugh and walk away. They join a sma group of people who applaud Andre's arrival. Andre does a little spin showing off his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris comes back to Rose. He is more creeped out and agit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean projects over the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone applauds and gives Dean their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Achem! Once again, I want to thank you all for coming. Words cannot express how much it means to us that after all these years we can all still get together and share. I'm reminded of stories of how the knights of old would gather in honor of a new crusade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During Dean's speech, Chris wanders away from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignorant shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris hadn't seen Jim Hudson, the blind man, who sits in gazebo with his seeing eye dog. He is close to Chris, but enough away from the group that no one else hears them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them. Ignorant assholes. They have no idea what real people go through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess people only see what's in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris notices his faux pas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh. No, you're right. And usually not even that much. That's people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim holds a glass up. Chris fist bumps the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Hudson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are. I'm an admirer of your work; you have a great eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Jim Hudson... of Hudson Galleries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The irony of being a blind art dealer isn't lost on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an assistant describe work to me. You've got something... The images you capture... so brutally melancholic. Powerful stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Yeah, I just like finding the beauty in abandoned things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to dabble myself. Wilderness mostly. I submitted to Nat Geo 14 times before realizing I didn't have "the eye" for it; Began dealing. And then, of course, my vision went to shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Life can be a sick joke. One day you're working in a dark room, and the next day - BAM. You wake up in the dark. Genetic disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit ain't fair, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy comes over with his preppy friend, Derrick, 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, we need you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop by the gallery some time. Bout time you had a solo show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Wow, okay. Thank you. That would be a game changer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we could do wonderful things together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose play badminton against Jeremy and Derrick. gaggle of party guests watch, entertained. Chris is actua having fun. He swings big but misses the shuttlecock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HA! Come on. You can do better than that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my game, what can I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, if your boy isn't gonna bring his `A' game, we might as well bring Mom up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, okay. Now we talkin' smack huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris serves the shuttlecock hard. The following rally is long, captivating the crowd. Chris ends it with an impres diving swat. Derrick misses the return and the crowd goes wild. Chris throws his arms up in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's what I'm talking about!!! Okay, again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is about to serve. He scans the crowd of beaming fa Everyone is rooting for Chris. They love him. Chris scans crowd. It's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gives his racket to Gordon Greene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks through the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slips past several small groups of guests mingling. goes up the stairs to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he are out of sight and earshot, the mingling guests stop in mid-conversation. Everyone in the room wai and listens to CHRIS' FOOTSTEPS above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now clear that their conversations have been fake. are all hanging on Chris' actions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks to Rose' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris exits the bathroom in Rose's room. The bed is made. picks his phone up from the dresser. It's unplugged and o batteries. That's odd. He plugs it in again as he hears a CREAK down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris leaves Rose's room. A door at the end of the hallwa a crack open. Chris slowly walks down the hall, and peers inside. A couple lacrosse trophies and one for ju-jitsu.
