Jeremy's room. Movement inside. It's Georgina making the The door creaks alerting her of his presence, she turns slowly. Before she sees him he walks quickly back to Rose room just as she comes upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris waves for her to join him back in her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris speaks quietly and frantically to Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The housekeeper unplugged my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sighs. "Not this again."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to check in with Rod, and I got no juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it was an honest mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, or maybe not. Maybe she doesn't like the fact that I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It's a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think my family's housekeeper gives a shit who you're with? That's crazy bae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sits on the bed and rubs his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Nevermind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I get it. This whole thing is stressful. I mean, they're circling you like hyenas down there. I just don't get why you're taking it out on George and Walter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm being paranoid. I just need a minute and I'll be down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose leaves a little annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod eats a cheeseburger and watches a true crime show on Chris' couch with Sid the dog. His PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is alone in Rose's room. He peers out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruh. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much. Sid's chillin'. We eatin' burgers. What's up with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.text: And thanks for that image, right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no, no, no, no... Aren't you the sweetest thing? Not at all. The Armitages are so good to us; They treat us like family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris! There you are. I wanted to introduce you to some old friends. We'll do it quickly. Down the line: David and Marcia Wincott, Ronald and Celia Jeffries, Hiroki Tanaka, and Fredrich and Jessika Walden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dean in Japanese) Can we ask him questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you find that being African American has more advantages or disadvantages in the modern world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pans the crowd who all give him their undivided attention. The silence is long. Chris sighs. He looks for Rose. She is off talking to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all smile like hungry vampires. Chris is very uncomfortable with this unprovoked group interrogation. A Logan and Phil approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's actually a great question. Logan! They were asking me about the African American experience. Maybe you could take this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan is a little caught off guard but dives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life as an African American has been, for the most part, very good. It's hard to be too specific as I haven't much desired to leave the house in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd chuckles. Chris takes out his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've become homebodies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But recently, even when you go to the city, I've just had no interest. (To the group) The chores are my sanctu--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the attention on Andre/Logan, Chris subtly backs awa from the conversation. He raises his phone toward Andre/L and the group and snaps a picture. The FLASH POPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to Chris. Andre/Logan steps forward and lo at Chris oddly; His head cocks a little and his peaceful expression drifts slowly to maddened horror. Some of the guests gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan drops his glass and stumbles towards Chris. C backs up, but Andre is already up in his space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan's voice is higher and scratchy, like it was i first scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, I'm sorry, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan grabs Chris by the shoulders and screams shri Blood trickles out of his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET THE FUCK OUT OF HERE!!!!

dialogues.text: Phil and Jeremy grab Andre. They have to pry Andre/Logan' grip off of Chris. When they do Andre/Logan screams bloodcurdlingly. It takes all their strength to bring him the house. Missy and Dean follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits on the couch. She's been crying. Chris comforts but is clearly traumatised. A few other concerned guests around. Dean enters everyone gives him their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the Hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seizure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Logan's okay. Missy's with him now. Are you okay Chris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why did he come at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah seizures don't make people attack people, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an abnormal manifestation but yes, actually, sometimes they do. The flash on your phone must have triggered it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre/Logan enters with stands with Missy and Phil to a smattering of concerned applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He addresses a group in his lower pitched "Logan" voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do believe I owe you all an apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group grumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just glad you're feeling yourself again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yes I am. It's quite like being trapped in a dark room and watching my experiences through a window. Thank God you and Dean were here to calm me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a simple glitch of the brain. Nothing to be afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I scared you all quite a bit.. especially you Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm sorry about the flash. I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. How could you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andre/Logan) You shouldn't have been drinking either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said I'm feeling much better now, but you'll all have to proceed without the aid of my marvellous wit; the whole thing has left me a quite a bit exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is skeptical. Missy shows Phil and Logan out. Andre Phil leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do sparklers shall we? Brighten the mood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Chris and Rose sparklers and to other people who light them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose takes Chris' hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody need a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going on a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose grabs Chris' hand and leads him out the front door. party guests in the living room, Dean and Missy included, silent. As their sparklers burn they approach the window, watching Rose and Chris leave the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Chris walk by the lake. Their sparklers fizzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cousin is epileptic. That wasn't a seizure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly? That was one of the strangest things I've ever seen in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, this is gonna sound weird, but when he got up in my face like that, I got the feeling like I knew that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Chris and Rose are away, the party guests have all gathered in the back yard facing Dean who stands by a lar picture of Chris on an easel. Everyone is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean raises his hand and makes numbers with his fingers: "Three and three." Several party guests raise their hands Dean points to the Waldens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an auction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go back home tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Wait, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just... Something doesn't feel right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. With this whole situation! I just... I can't explain but I need you to trust me. Let's just go. It doesn't even have to be a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a big deal. It's my family. I wouldn't even know what to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean raises his hand again making more numbers with his fingers: "4, 5."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon Greene raises his hand. Dean points to him accepti his bid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's weird. There are a lot of ways I wish this was going different. I wish my brother wasn't a cock. I wish my parents friends were chill; but just because it's tough, it doesn't mean you run away...

dialogues.text: Rose cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I--

dialogues.text: ...I'm late.

dialogues.text: Late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've got my period like last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I did change my birth control, so it could just be that, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris thinks silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Try any emotional response whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's silent. Rose wipes her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanna go then go. I'm not going to force you to stay but I'm not leaving.

dialogues.text: The auction is flying now. Dean's hand signals are going It's down to three couples.

dialogues.text: Dean signals "5, 6." Mr. Greene raises his hand. Dean poi

dialogues.text: Dean signals "6." Jim Hudson raises both his hands and si "10." His chauffeur stands beside him whispering in his e Dean points at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean scans the crowd signalling "10, 2?" "10, 2?" The cro looks around. No one is challenging. Dean smiles. Finally bangs his fist onto his open palm and points to Jim Hudso Jim's chauffeur whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests clap in a mixture of delight and disappointmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose sit watching the sunset over the lake. Chr kisses her hand. He hears the faint APPLAUSE in the dista He looks in the direction of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you about the night my mom died. How I didn't call 911; didn't go out looking for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour went by, then two, three... I just sat there... I just watched TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't your fault--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out later she had survived the initial hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laid there bleeding by the side of the road all night, cold and alone. And that's how she died in the early morning... Cold and alone. And I was watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was time. If someone was looking for her, there was time. But no one was looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris cries. Rose embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah. So, I'm not gonna leave here without you. I`m not going to abandon you. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a moment of pure love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Come on. Let's go back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean, you're right. This sucks. I'll go back with you. I'll make something up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two get up and walk back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Rose approach the house as the last of the gues get into their cars and drive off. The fireflies are out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: The guests wave to Dean and Missy, who stand at the front door, and then to Chris and Rose. Lisa Deets, the trophy is tipsy. Nelson is in their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Chris! It was a pleasure meeting you. I hope you--

dialogues.text: Chris and Rose wave.

dialogues.text: Come on, Lisa. Before you say something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs. Walter shuts the car door behind Lisa. Walt stands pleasantly watching the cars leave. He turns to Ch with the same `ol smile. Chris and Rose enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sink running. Chris washes his hands and looks in the mir

dialogues.text: His phone SIGNALS a text message from Rod. It's picture f the internet of witches in a circle around a man being sacrificed followed by the text message. "You dead yet?" texts back. "Bruh, you have no idea." He finds the pictur took of Logan/Andre on his phone and sends it.

dialogues.text: Moments later, his phone vibrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Dre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andre um... Hayworth! Yeah! He used to kick it with Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Teresa's sister! Worked at the movie theatre on 8th;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: got us into the movie a couple of times; Rush hour 2 and, um Usual Suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That is him. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so fuckin' crazy. He's different now.

dialogues.text: Different? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different. Slower... I mean he was street; now he's all like... white- seeming. Oh, plus he's gay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he ain't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you: He's gay, I met his man. He's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, you in a fucked up Eyes Wide Shut situation. You need to--.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone goes dead. No batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' phone lays on the dresser plugged in. He's in a hu now. He packs his small bag and looks out the window. One remains parked in the designated parking area. It's the f to have arrived for the party: Jim Hudson's. The driver b the dog to the back seat. He gets a green envelope from t glove compartment and brings it to Missy at the front doo She accepts it silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver drives away without Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris goes to leave Rose's room. Her closet creaks open. sees a framed picture of Rose inside. Not quite knowing w he's looking for, he goes to the closet. The picture is a frightening one. Rose is one of the witches in a high sch production of Macbeth. It's on top of a red shoebox that the drama/comedy masks drawn on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it off of the shelf. Inside is a pile of picture top is one of Rose dressed as Juliet in a high school pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next one is of Rose at 13 playing Ms. Hannigan in Ann Chris flips through a few more pictures of Rose at differ ages in different class plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Chris comes upon a photo printed from a computer. a selfie of her and some other black guy. The picture is almost identical to the one she took with Chris before th ride up. Under the image are written the words. "X-mas 20 Stunned, Chris flips to the next picture. It's another romantic selfie, this time with a different black guy. Underneath, the caption "Memorial Day 2013"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues flipping through the stack of pictures of Ro with 8 different black guys. The last one is a picture of with Walter. In it she kisses Walter's cheek intimately. "Thanksgiving 2009" Walter looks different in the picture isn't smiling vaguely; he's got swagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stands there in the doorway behind him. Chris subtly drops the pictures back in the shoebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Looking for my camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose points to her desk. He grabs his bag and the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the keys..? I gotta put our bags in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose is truly distant for the first time. A different per She is methodical and emotionless. The jig is up, and now is now phoning it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just looking for them. I'm such a mess, will you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks out the door, leaving Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose follows Chris down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris... What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy stands near the front door twirling his lacrosse s Dean and Missy sit in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? The party's just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the car; see if we left the keys in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family is silent. Missy's glare pierces Chris. He avo eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know where they are. In my bag. Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Well, yeah... Um.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His dog is not well. He needs to go to the vet first thing in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean hits play on the sound system. Darkly valiant classi music begins. He standing in front of the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost in the fire, Dean begins conducting the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your purpose, Chris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In life? What is your purpose..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, it's finding the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been looking for our purpose for such a long time. Fire has mesmerized man since the Stone Age. It is a reflection of our impermanence in the world. Fire is born, it breathes and then it dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose lamely rummages through her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose, what is this shit?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a reason we worship the Sun, Chris. He who lights the way through the darkness of life. He in all his glory was around long before us and will be here long after we are gone, but he too will die some day! That's right even the Sun God will die. It is no less mortal than we, but it inspires us to defy it! So what do we do?--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Rose.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --What do we do?! We baptize ourselves in the firewater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bathe in his reflection, for one chance to emerge having defied death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd take that baptism wouldn't you, Chris? The baptism of immortality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was raised Episcopalian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris starts toward the door, but his path is blocked by Jeremy swinging at air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Be careful, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him, Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I'm not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Chris--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't know what you're saying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through tears of joyous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying that we've found OUR PURPOSE!!! There must be a sacrifice! Sacrifice is essential for the righteous to achieve our true potential. A vessel must be comprised. A host must be born!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose! The keys!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby... You know I can't give you the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris makes a run for the door. Missy CLINKS the cup with SPOON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world instantly blurs around Chris. He begins to fall sees a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris falls through the abyss towards `The Sunken Place' just like when he was hypnotized. The blue screen above h shows what his open eyes see. It's his own perspective fa to the floor. CRASH! The screen now shows the living room ceiling. Jeremy leans over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see him drop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit his head pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a bump. He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose!!!

dialogues.text: Where's Rose?

dialogues.text: Hot isn't she? Hot voice anyway, you dirty dog. You're one of the lucky one's. The son Jeremy's wrangling method sounds way less pleasant.

dialogues.text: They asked me for my favorite song, which was hard; I like all types of music. Turns out they really just needed one I knew all the words to: I went with James Taylor's "You Got a Friend." I hope it hasn't been too torturous; that wasn't the point. The point is that you learn it, and for us to have that knowledge in common.

dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right. Okay, let me back up and give you the cliff notes. The Armitages and I are a part of a society. A pretty extraordinary society actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One whose sole purpose for many many years has been a search for a very powerful object. Armitage lineage redefined the nature of that search. They proved that the power didn't just exist in that object; You see, with science the Armitage's created a miracle.

dialogues.text: You hypnotize me? Break my will..? Make me a slave like the others? This is some crazy racist shit.

dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready...? Drum roll please. Brain transplantation. Some say it could never be done;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They experimented for centuries, but it turned out re-linking the brain to a foreign central nervous system was impossible. The nerve connections are far too intricate and delicate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean's the only guy who really gets the science. He's the one who discovered that full brain transplantation isn't actually necessary to transfer the soul, and that partial brain transplantation solves the little nerve ending problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim holds up a Color coded diagram of the human Brain. Th is a big red part that takes up 80% of the image. The oth 20% is blue and located near the lower back of his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay so... You see the blue part? That's the piece of your brain that's all rooted in the nervous system. So that stays; keeping those tricky little connections intact. The rest is discarded. Then they'll remove the red part of my brain from my skull and put in yours. Your "blue" and my "red" basically absorb each other. And apparently the brain heals surprisingly fast, so assuming everything goes as planned, we should be up and functioning in a couple weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my brain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your red part? It'll be discarded, but don't worry. You wont be gone. Well not completely. You'll still be in there somewhere; limited consciousness of course;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you'll still be able to see and hear but your existence will be as a passenger... an audience. You will live in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The Sunken Place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's what she calls it. Good! So you understand, I'll control the motor functions, the will of our body, effectively

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me... You will be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the world is concerned. It's still a pretty new operation. Some kinks. We're supposed to stay away from flashes of light for example. They can trigger a "momentary lapse in control of motor functions..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why black people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is disappointed in the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, because you get the highest bids. For the last decade or so anyway. I wish it was less simple than that, but it's not. You're in fashion, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Final hope sinks from. Chris shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly though, personally..? I couldn't give two shits about race. I don't care if you're black, brown, green, purple... whatever. What I want is so much deeper: Your eye, man. I want those things you see through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have and we will. We'll be together soon, brother.

dialogues.text: The television turns off. Chris clenches his body trying pry free from his restraints, before his shoulders collap with exhaustion. He lifts his head to a rip in the leathe of the chair revealing its cotton stuffing. He looks at t cotton. We see Chris make a difficult decision.

dialogues.text: Shhhh.

She lunges at Chris screaming psychotically Chris can't pin her down. She slices his hands. Chris gra the tea pot and cracks her in the head with it. She falls hits her one more time. Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
